Description: Camel saddle with wooden seat, frame and oval pommels, one at each end. A padded leather cushion is secured to the seat by means of two holes through which the pommels pass. The saddle is held together with leather thongs, metal plates and screws.
Curator's comments: Eth.Doc.118. Saddle is typical of the type used by the Egyptian Army Camel Corps during the First World War. It was given to the donors in 1935 by Major Toye, a WW1 V.C.
Condition: Well worn, but otherwise in fair condition.
Acquisition notes: Af1991,02.1 and 2 were bequeathed to the BM by Mr Reginald and Mrs Helen Massa (though their son Mr Paul Massey); it had been given to Reginald Massa in Cairo in the 1930s (note in the donation book).
Conservation: Surface cleaning to remove museum dirt, external surface particulate matter accumilated in museum storage.
